overview:
Adam Simon is Co-founder & Chief Creative Officer of Socialbomb, a social technology company born and raised in New York City. Socialbomb’s platform connects blu-ray players, mobile phones, and other connected devices to online social networks.

Adam completed his Masterâ€™s Degree in Interactive Telecommunications from NYU (ITP), after completing research into game design, social networking, physical computing, and human computer interaction. Socialbomb grew out of that research and collaboration with classmates Scott Varland and Mike Dory, and won the Stern Business Plan Competition in 2008. He also holds a BA in Theater from UCLA, class of 2002.

Early in his career, Adam managed one of the first commercial video podcasts for Axe while working as Digital Media Manager for Conductor LA. From there he went to CBS, where he produced online video content for CBS Primetime, Daytime, and sister network UPN. While in grad school, he worked with social gaming company Area/Code on a number of projects, including their MediaRES local streaming servers and the Discovery Channel’s Sharkrunners game.
